;;8 月 20 日，不列颠哥伦比亚省 Scotch Creek 的空气中弥漫着野火的浓烟。野火向大气中释放了大量碳。
;

;根据最新发布的一份报告，加拿大的减排计划不足以实现到 2030 年将排放量比 2005 年水平减少 40% 至 45% 的目标审计长办公室周二发表的一份声明称，审计发现政府的计划不够充分，因为实现 2030 年目标所需的关键措施被推迟或没有优先考虑。< /p>;

;

;;相关：;;特鲁多停止征收碳税可能会毁掉他多年的主打气候政策;

;
;

;达不到 2030 年 40% 的最低目标将意味着加拿大无法兑现其承诺根据联合国关于气候变化的《巴黎协定》。

;

;加拿大去年发布了第一个实现 2030 年气候目标的真正路线图，制定了详细计划和 91 亿加元（66 亿美元）的新支出来削减审计发现，减少排放的责任分散在不直接向加拿大环境和气候变化部长负责的多个联邦实体中，但在取得进展和路线修正方面，多年来未能实现其目标。困难。

;

;加拿大未能实现其设定的每一项减排目标，但总理贾斯汀·特鲁多一再表示应对气候变化是其政府的首要任务之一。

;

;起草该报告的环境与可持续发展专员杰里·德马科 (Jerry DeMarco) 表示，政府仍然可以“凭借动力、重点和领导力”实现 2030 年目标。

;

;审计发现，该计划具有强大的潜在潜力减少排放的措施，例如碳定价和监管，但它也有许多弱点，“包括信息缺失和不一致以及不可靠的预测，这些都损害了该计划的可信度”。

; Wed, 08 Nov 2023 04:52:01 +0800 Chile’s right wing presents draft conservative constitutionhttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/nov/07/chile-new-constitution-conservative-boric
;;2023-11-07T20:41:51Z;
;
;;内政部长卡罗琳·托哈 (Caroline Toha) 作为智利总统加布里埃尔·博里奇 (Gabriel Boric) 和部长秘书长阿尔瓦罗 (Álvaro) 签署宪法草案Elizalde，您看，11 月 7 日在圣地亚哥。
;

;智利激进右翼在宪法草案中提出了他们对未来的保守愿景，一些观察家认为该宪法草案是该国的倒退。

;

;新草案可能会取代现行宪法皮诺切特时代的宪章是由极右翼共和党领导的委员会起草的，可能会威胁堕胎、限制集体罢工行动的权利，并会减少当选智利国会议员的人数。

;
;

;;相关：;;“巨大的倒退”：智利的极右势力威胁堕胎权;

;
;

;左翼总统加布里埃尔·博里奇在周二的仪式上收到了新草案在圣地亚哥，他正式呼吁 12 月 17 日举行公民投票，所有智利人都必须对该提案进行投票。

;

;这一时刻标志着四年政治戏剧的最新转折：2019 年，根深蒂固的不平等和政治不满引发了数月的时间政治动荡。为了平息抗议，政治领导人同意开始更换该国 1980 年宪法，尽管进行了数十项改革，该宪法仍然不受欢迎。

;

;初稿被称为世界上最进步的宪法，;在 2022 年 9 月的公民投票中被压倒性地否决< /a>;.现在，智利人将投票选出政治光谱另一端的替代方案。

;

;与初稿的呈现形成鲜明对比 - 其中该国 10 个土著人民的代表穿着传统服装 - 博里克受到了侧翼的关注现任宪法委员会主席、讲德语的贝阿特丽斯·赫维亚 (Beatriz Hevia) 撰文，她将公民投票描述为“真正的智利人”的希望得以实现的日子。

;

;就像皮诺切特时代的文件一样，它的目的是作为替代，新提案没有提及智利原住民，尽管近 13% 的人口被认为是原住民。

;

;Boric 表示，如果该文件被接受，他的政府将致力于其实施，如果被拒绝，它将侧重于“继续为人民的福祉而工作和执政”。

;

;之前的草案因篇幅过长而受到批评——它将成为世界上最长的宪法之一——而且内容广泛权利清单，保障从医疗保健和教育的普遍权利到保护烹饪遗产和动物福利的一切。

;

;新草案中最具争议的条款之一说，“法律保护人民的生命”未出生”，现行宪法的措辞略有变化，一些人警告说，这可能会使堕胎在这个南美国家完全非法。目前，在强奸的情况下，如果母亲有生命危险并且胎儿无法生存，终止妊娠是合法的。

;

;在初稿失败后，智利各政党制定了一项严格的法律受控的第二个程序，每个阶段都必须进行投票，国会提名的专家将起草一份预提案供当选代表修改。

;

;在投票前媒体对公共安全的狂热报道中，极端保守的共和党人该党在 5 月份的选举中发起猛攻，并在精简后的宪法委员会中占据了三分之一以上的席位。

; Wed, 08 Nov 2023 04:52:01 +0800 EU expected to start process of Ukraine and Moldova becoming member stateshttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/nov/07/eu-expected-to-start-process-of-ukraine-and-moldova-becoming-member-states

;
;;布鲁塞尔欧盟委员会大楼前的旗帜。
;

;欧盟预计将开火乌克兰和摩尔多瓦成为成员国的进程打响了发令枪，预计将有一份报告建议就加入事宜进行正式谈判。

;

;摩尔多瓦副总理尼古拉·波佩斯库 (Nicolae Popescu) 表示，此举将是他的一个重要里程碑。国家。他说：“这将是一项真正的历史性成就，也是确保摩尔多瓦巩固其在欧盟地位的真正历史性机会。”

;

;一份 1,200 页的报告将于周三中午后发布，其中包含建议前往 12 月举行的峰会进行最终签署。

;
;

;;相关：;;乌克兰副总理表示，乌克兰不希望在加入欧盟方面获得同情票;

;
;

;该报告将是首次正式盘点乌克兰和摩尔多瓦在司法治理、腐败、经济、媒体独立和少数群体权利等方面与欧盟保持一致的进展。

;

;还将发布其他七个等待加入欧盟的国家的最新信息，包括巴尔干国家和土耳其，尽管其入盟之路在几年前就遇到了障碍。

;

;有报道称，欧盟委员会将在报告发布后首次建议给予格鲁吉亚正式候选国地位.

;

;然而，所有的目光都将集中在乌克兰和摩尔多瓦，这两个国家;于 2022 年 6 月获得候选国地位。;

;

;一份临时报告赞扬两国在欧盟委员会方面取得的进展，得出的结论是乌克兰已完成七项改革中的两项在五个方面取得了良好或一些进展。

;

;摩尔多瓦被告知需要在反腐败和司法治理等九个领域进行改革。它在 6 月份完成了其中三项任务，其中三项任务取得了良好进展，其余任务也取得了一些进展。

;

;摩尔多瓦是一个位于罗马尼亚和乌克兰之间、拥有约 250 万人口的国家，通常不会获得太多国际收入与乌克兰一样，摩尔多瓦也认为其未来的安全取决于欧盟，该国总统马亚·桑杜 (Maia Sandu) 声称瓦格纳该组织计划对该国发动政变。

;

;波佩斯库表示，他对周三欧盟委员会报告中的良好结果充满信心，因为该国 15 年来一直与欧盟结盟。

;

;根据一份关于其进展的讨论文件，摩尔多瓦在6月至9月期间加速了协调，成立了35个工作组，为入盟谈判做准备。

;

;它还对约300名公务员进行了有关欧盟事务和欧盟的培训机构并启动了一项筛选计划，以确定入盟谈判的欧盟立法计划。

;

;“多年来，我们一直在做巴尔干在经济、外交政策、内部安全领域所做的许多事情，但我们直到去年才获得候选资格，所以我们的经验是，如果坚持下去，每隔几年你就会取得新水平的突破。”他在谈到下一阶段的正式谈判时说道。

;

;上周，乌克兰副总理表示，他们也期待委员会报告坚持认为会取得积极成果;不想因为战争而得到任何“折扣;”。

; Wed, 08 Nov 2023 04:22:01 +0800 Fleece of ‘Britain’s loneliest sheep’ to be sold for charityhttps://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2023/nov/07/fleece-of-britains-loneliest-sheep-to-be-sold-for-charity
;;2023-11-07T18:58:10Z;
;
;;菲奥娜羊和她的救援人员。
;

;英国最孤独的羊的羊毛即将出售，在剪羊毛人给她焕然一新后，这笔钱将捐给慈善机构。

;

;这只母羊名叫菲奥娜，;在与羊群分离两年多后于周六获救;

;

;现在，这个三岁的女孩的羊毛被剪掉并送到专业编织者那里，现在她几乎无法辨认了。

;

;希望 Fiona 粉丝很快就能买到纪念品，Wooldale Wool 生产的纪念品将出售或抽奖以资助苏格兰防止虐待动物协会 (SSPCA) 和苏格兰动物保护协会 RSABI农业心理健康慈善机构的分支机构。

;

;使用手剪来确保羊有一件过冬的外套，她将用这些外套来适应其他羊以及邓弗里斯 Dalscone Farm Fun 的工作人员.

;

;“她吃得很好，喝得很好，做得很棒，”为她剪毛的救援队成员卡米·威尔逊 (Cammy Wilson) 说道。

;

;菲奥娜已经成为了一个不太可能的名人，来自农场的帖子被浏览了 300 万次。她曾在 ITV 的《This Morning》节目中进行现场直播，她的故事已传遍世界各地，并被《纽约时报》等媒体报道。

;

;她的困境让人想起;史莱克，一只新西兰羊;，它从围栏里逃出来，六年没有被抓到，此时它已经长出了重达 27 公斤的羊毛– 足够制作 20 套大号男士西装的羊毛。她的救援人员在给她取名菲奥娜时考虑到了这一点。

;

;但她的故事并非没有争议 - 她在周日晚上在黑暗的掩护下搬到了新家，原因是她被躲藏起来。抗议者抵达达尔斯科内。

;

;周日，警方在;工作人员对来自动物崛起组织的和平抗议者的出现感到害怕;。

;

;之前在救援过程中，动物崛起的成员花了三天时间爬上悬崖，与土地所有者合作，与菲奥娜（他们称之为“绵羊”）建立信任。

;

;他们声称他们已达成协议，将拯救这只动物并带走她被带到格拉斯哥附近的一个避难所。然而，周六早上，当该组织出发去取物资时，他们说业主带来了一些带走羊的农民。

;

;该组织的发言人罗伯特戈登说：“我们想要的一切是让她待在庇护所里，而不是在宠物动物园里成为奇观。”

;

;他说，活动人士希望找到妥协方案。然而，菲奥娜最终的救援者希望批评者能够理解她处于一个安全舒适的地方。

;

;威尔逊在社交媒体帖子中表示：“我希望公众的所有支持能够说服他们反对我们正在做的事情的人离开，让我们完成工作。”

; Wed, 08 Nov 2023 03:22:01 +0800 Children of dictatorship military urge Argentinians to reject ‘fascist’ Mileihttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/nov/07/argentina-election-milei-massa-dictatorship-letter-historias-desobedientes

;;阿根廷总统候选人哈维尔·米莱 (Javier Milei) 将挑战数十年来关于独裁统治的共识作为其竞选活动的主要部分。
;

;在阿根廷独裁统治期间被判犯有反人类罪和种族灭绝罪的军官的后代敦促选民不要在即将到来的选举中支持极右翼候选人哈维尔·米莱，并警告说该国的民主正处于危险之中。

;

;在 11 月 19 日米雷和他的中间派竞争对手塞尔吉奥·马萨 (Sergio Massa) 决选之前发表的一封公开信中，Historias Desobedientes（不服从故事）团体表达了“极大的担忧”，右翼激进分子和他的竞选伙伴维多利亚·维拉鲁尔 (Victoria Villarruel) 有机会赢得权力。

;
;

;;相关：;;阿根廷极右翼领跑者重新揭开独裁的伤口;

;
;

;激起1976-83年阿根廷政权受害者的愤怒、米雷和维拉鲁埃尔;挑战了长达数十年的共识; 反对独裁统治并质疑受害者人数是他们竞选活动的重要组成部分。

;

;“米雷和他的副总统候选人曾多次公开反对民主，否认失踪人数，称犯罪行为反人类“过度”，并指责;母亲和祖母五月广场;——我们民主无可辩驳的支柱——是骗子，”该组织在提到那些;花了数年时间要求得到亲人死亡和失踪的答案。;

;

;估计有 30,000 名政权反对者被杀或失踪独裁统治期间 - 几乎所有人都是手无寸铁的平民。

;

;不服从故事的信 - ;这是由独裁政权成员的孩子们创建的，他们对父母的罪行感到震惊; - Milei 声称米雷的政府计划比他竞选中的“公然否认”还要危险。

;

;“米雷寻求实施与独裁政权相同的计划，他有同样的政治目标，即消灭所有他认为是‘左撇子’的人” ”，声明警告说，声称 Milei 还将关闭工会，摧毁阿根廷货币并导致恶性通货膨胀。

;

;“让我们付出了如此多的血、汗和泪水的民主正处于危险之中，”该组织补充道.

;

;口语;谁在政权反对者被扔死之前给他们下药;来自“死亡航班”的飞机。

;
;

;;相关：;;阿根廷死亡飞行：一个儿子争取作证反对父亲的权利;;

;

;但维尔纳声称马萨是“最不坏的选择”，因为它允许人们“继续为更好的生活条件和社会正义以及免受多种压迫的自由而奋斗”。

;

;距离决选还有不到两周的时间，民意调查显示，阿根廷自 1983 年 12 月恢复民主以来最重要的总统选举之一，势均力敌。

;

;在 10 月第一轮投票之前，米雷一位古怪的自由主义者，以其脏话和将器官出售合法化等激进提议而闻名，被广泛认为是领先者，成功地控制了公众对阿根廷经济低迷状况的愤怒。

;

;然而，53岁的政治局外人;出人意料地被马萨挤到了第一名;，51 岁，获得了 36.6% 的选票，米莱获得了 29.9% 的选票。

;

;尽管马萨在担任财政部长期间经历了阿根廷数十年来最严重的经济衰退之一，十分之四的经济衰退，但他还是赢得了胜利。人民生活贫困，年通货膨胀率接近140%。

;

;许多专家认为，米莱未能获胜是选民被这位头发蓬乱的政客的激进思想和飘忽不定、咄咄逼人的风格吓跑的结果。

;

; p>;

;布宜诺斯艾利斯咨询公司 Cefeidas Group 的董事总经理胡安·克鲁斯·迪亚斯 (Juan Cruz Díaz) 表示，无法预测马萨和米莱在 12 天后对峙时会发生什么。

;

;“无论哪种方式都可能发生……如果任何分析师告诉你这些人中的哪一个会获胜，他们可能夸大了他们的分析能力，”他说。

;;英国内阁大臣兼公务员系统负责人西蒙·凯斯
;

;两位最资深的民事据对新冠病毒的调查得知，英国的仆人们交换了信息，称鲍里斯·约翰逊(Boris Johnson)唐宁街内部的人“有毒”、“疯狂”，不适合管理国家。

;

;“我从来没有见过一群人时任内阁办公室主任的西蒙·凯斯 (Simon Case) 于 2020 年 7 月写信给内阁秘书马克·塞德威尔 (Mark Sedwill)。

;

;凯斯接替了塞德威尔的第二职务。几个月后，他仍然担任内阁大臣，还回忆道，他告诉约翰逊，许多高级官员不想在唐宁街工作，“因为他的业务声誉不佳”。疫情期间约翰逊的幕僚长爱德华·乌德尼-利斯特 (Edward Udny-Lister) 在取证期间进行的调查进一步突显了在此期间 10 号大楼内看似有毒的气氛。

;
;

;;相关：;< a href="https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2023/nov/07/westminster-is-rife-with-entitlement-syndrome-during-covid-it-cost-lives">;威斯敏斯特充满了“权利综合症”。新冠疫情期间，它夺去了生命|贾斯汀·格林宁;

;
;

;李斯特在自己的证词中证实，约翰逊曾一度在电视上谈到注射新冠病毒，以表明它无害，后来在大流行期间表示”几个月。这些人太疯狂了。 （还没有）对我有毒，但他们只是疯狂地弄巧成拙。”

;

;Sedwill 回答道：“到目前为止你还好，因为你已经经历了好消息阶段。等到莱斯特城增多（由于新冠病例激增，当地实施了限制），毛皮就会飞起来。小心点。”

;

;

;在他的证据中，李斯特还证实了卡明斯首先描述的两件轶事，即李斯特所说的约翰逊在会议上发表的“不幸”评论。

;

;;德国总理奥拉夫·肖尔茨 (Olaf Scholz) 参加了在柏林举行的关于庇护程序的马拉松式会谈。

;官方统计数据显示，今年 1 月至 9 月，庇护申请量比去年同期增加了约 73%，达到 25 万多人.

;这与自 2022 年俄罗斯入侵以来抵达的超过 100 万乌克兰人不同，他们不需要申请庇护。

;

;进入这场充满争议的辩论肖尔茨称这项改革是“向呼吸系统的过渡”，并表示新措施意味着“随着人数的增加，钱会更多，随着人数的下降，钱会更少”。

;

;此举发生在数小时内。意大利总理周一公布了一项单独的移民协议，该协议将在阿尔巴尼亚为数千名通过海路抵达的人建立接待中心。

;

;周二，乔治亚·梅洛尼 (Giorgia Meloni) 在接受《信使报》采访时表示这些计划可以成为“欧盟与非欧盟国家之间合作的典范”。

;

;“最新决定无国界医生组织表示，这项协议“超越了一步”。此前欧盟国家与土耳其、利比亚和突尼斯达成的协议。 “其目的不再只是阻止人们离开，而是积极防止人们逃离以及海上获救的人安全快速地进入欧洲领土，从而绕过国际法和欧洲公约规定的保护和救援义务。” ”在一份声明中说。“拒绝进入意大利领土、对庇护申请进行域外管理、实施加速边境程序以及在第三国拘留人员，这是对意大利的新攻击。获得庇护的权利。这些举措重复了遏制和威慑政策，这些政策已被证明从长期来看是无效的，但却能够增加成千上万人的痛苦。”

;

;发言人乔治亚·利纳迪(Giorgia Linardi); ;救援非政府组织 Sea;-; 表示，该协议代表“意大利政府对国际和欧盟庇护法的一次新的正面攻击，利用国际承认的愿望和第三国的脆弱性来逃避其制裁”。庇护责任。”

;

;这些计划引起了欧盟高层人士的恐慌。内部人士表示，欧盟委员会仅“一小时收到”该协议的通知，该协议可能会在阿尔巴尼亚处理多达 36,000 名移民。

;

;一位官员称这是 Meloni 的“令人讨厌”的举动，在移民法最终谈判前夕，旨在为意大利、希腊和其他面临非正常移民大幅增加的边境国家提供解决方案。

;

;梅洛尼的协议最初将使移民中心容纳约 3,000 人，但最终每年处理多达 36,000 名移民。她表示，为了减少通过海路抵达意大利的移民数量，该计划是必要的。与去年同期相比，意大利的移民数量增加了约 65%。

;

;她的计划被拿来与意大利政府有争议的努力进行比较。英国政府向卢旺达派遣数千名寻求庇护者，但由于法律障碍而受阻。

;

;欧盟委员会发言人表示，正在向意大利寻求详细信息，但警告称，必须确保任何“安排都得到充分落实” ”。

;

;在柏林，肖尔茨表示，他的政府仍在考虑欧盟以外的庇护程序是否可行，但尚未准备好就长期以来高度重视的问题做出决定。这是一个有争议的问题。

;

;帕尔克表示，关于是否允许在欧盟之外进行庇护程序的讨论“在法律上和实际上都是不可能的，因此是一个伪解决方案”。

;A new poll shows Florida's hard-right governor, Ron DeSantis, falling even further behind Donald Trump in his own state, one day before the embattled candidate for the Republican presidential nomination takes the debate stage in Miami.

;

;The study by the University of North Florida (UNF) ;published on Tuesday; shows DeSantis trailing Trump by 39 points (60-21) among Republican Florida voters, with the former South Carolina governor Nikki Haley a distant third on 6%.

;

;
;

;A ;July poll; by Florida Atlantic University gave Trump a 50-30 lead over DeSantis in a similar hypothetical primary election.

;

;In a straight head-to-head match-up, Trump holds a 59-29 advantage, with 12% not making a choice, according to the new UNF study.

;

;“Despite historically high approval in the polls, Governor DeSantis losing steam in his home state doesn't bode well for his national campaign,” said Michael Binder, professor of political science at UNF and director of its public opinion research lab.

;

;“Even if you wipe out the rest of the competition in a head-to-head, Trump leads DeSantis by 20 points.”

;

;The Florida poll reflects DeSantis's ;plunging popularity; nationally as he struggles to keep his once-healthy campaign afloat. But the dip in his own state, where he was re-elected governor one year ago by a margin of 20%, will be particularly galling.

;

;Trump, who will be hosting a rival rally in Hialeah on Wednesday night only a few miles from the downtown Miami debate stage, has seized on DeSantis's stumbles, calling him “a wounded bird falling from the sky” in campaign messaging.

;

;Haley, too, has mocked DeSantis during a ;recent surge in her own popularity; to an unlikely position as leading alternative to Trump in several early primary states.

;

;“We'll see if he can run in them,” ;she said; of DeSantis's campaign appearances in cowboy boots reportedly containing height-boosting hidden heels, amid more serious attacks over his foreign policy relating to the Ukraine and Gaza conflicts, and China.

;

;DeSantis did pick up the ;endorsement of Iowa's governor, Kim Reynolds;, on Monday night, but has struggled to find influential Republican backing in Florida. Rick Scott, his predecessor as governor and now the state's junior senator, came out for Trump last week, followed by the ;defections of five Florida legislators; previously in the DeSantis camp.

;

;“Weakening DeSantis's standing in Florida is a clear objective of the Trump campaign,” Alex Conant, a Republican strategist, told the Associated Press over the weekend.

;

;“His entire message is built on the idea that he is a terrific governor. When Republican officials in Florida are choosing Trump over DeSantis, it really weakens the core of DeSantis's pitch.”

; Wed, 08 Nov 2023 00:52:02 +0800 Portuguese PM António Costa resigns amid corruption inquiryhttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/nov/07/portuguese-pm-antonio-costa-resigns-amid-corruption-inquiry
;;2023-11-07T15:49:17Z;
;
;;António Costa won a third consecutive term as prime minister following an election in January 2022.
;

;Portugal's socialist prime minister, António Costa, has resigned hours after prosecutors examining alleged corruption involving lithium and “green” hydrogen deals announced that he was under investigation and police searched dozens of addresses, including his official residence and the environment and infrastructure ministries.

;

;Speaking on Tuesday afternoon following two emergency meetings with Portugal's president, Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa, Costa said he had submitted his resignation, adding he had a “clear conscience” and “complete trust in justice” and how it worked.

;

;“The duties of prime minister are not compatible with any suspicion of my integrity,” he told a press conference. “In these circumstances, I have presented my resignation to the president of the republic.”

;

;Costa, who won a third consecutive term as prime minister after his party secured a ;surprise absolute majority; in a ;snap general election; held in January 2022, said he had stepped down despite having been “completely willing to dedicate myself with all my energy to fulfilling the mandate until the end of this legislature”. He also said he would not be running in any forthcoming elections.

;

;His announcement came after the Portuguese press reported that at least five people had been detained, including Costa's chief of staff, Vítor Escária, and Costa's friend, the business consultant Diogo Lacerda Machado.

;

;The public prosecutor's office then revealed that Costa himself was being investigated, adding the prime minister's “name and authority” had been cited by suspects questioned during the investigation.

;

;Rebelo de Sousa confirmed that he had accepted Costa's resignation and would be meeting party leaders later this week to convene a council of state. He is then expected to dissolve parliament.

;

;In January this year, prosecutors said that they were looking into allegations of corruption relating to lithium and hydrogen projects but did not name any suspects.

;

;The investigation into the alleged “misuse of funds, active and passive corruption by political figures, and influence peddling” involves lithium mining concessions in the north of the country. It is also investigating a hydrogen production project and data centre to be built by the company Start Campus in Sines, a town about 100km (62 miles) south of Lisbon.

;

;In a statement released on Tuesday, prosecutors said 42 premises had been searched by police and staff from its Criminal Investigation and Action Department.

;

;It confirmed that the addresses searched “in order to identify and seize documents and others relevant evidence” had included “spaces used by the head of the prime minister's office”, the two ministries and the Sines town council.

;

;Citing flight risk and the possibility that illegal activity could continue, prosecutors said arrest warrants had been issued for Costa's chief of staff, the mayor of Sines, and two executives at Start Campus.

;

;Prosecutors also said that Portugal's infrastructure minister, João Galamba, had been indicted as part of the investigation, as had the president of the executive board of the Portuguese Agency for the Protection of the Environment (APA).

;

;In May, the APA approved a mining project for lithium, an essential metal for the manufacturing of electric batteries. A second project was given the green light at the start of September.

;

;Earlier this year, Rebelo de Sousa told the government to clean up its act after a separate ;scandal around state-owned airline TAP;.

;

;Opposition politicians called for him to resign as news of the searches and arrests broke.

;

;The conservative CDS-People's party urged Costa to step down, saying “given the seriousness of the current situation and the bankruptcy of the socialist government , the prime minister must immediately submit his resignation”.

;

;André Ventura, the leader of the far-right Chega party also said Costa had to resign in order to end “the wave of suspicion” and to allow Portugal to renew itself.

;

;But Costa's former allies in the Communist party and the Left Bloc called for the facts to be investigated before any conclusions were drawn.

;

;“Democracy demands that there be no power above the law,” said the Left Bloc MP Pedro Filipe Soares. “Find out what there is to find out, investigate what there is to investigate. Justice must be quick, swift and transparent.”

; Tue, 07 Nov 2023 23:52:02 +0800 Greener electric car batteries among Prince William’s £1m Earthshot winnershttps://www.theguardian.com/environment/2023/nov/07/greener-electric-car-batteries-among-prince-william-1m-earthshot-winners
;;2023-11-07T15:14:23Z;
;
;;Prince William with some of the 2023 Earthshot prize winners at an awards ceremony in Singapore on Tuesday 7 November
;

;Scientists who developed a cleaner and more sustainable way to make batteries for electric cars were among the winners of this year's Prince of Wales's £1m ;Earthshot ;prizes.

;

;The awards, announced at a lavish ceremony in Singapore on Tuesday, are aimed at rewarding innovative solutions to tackle the climate and biodiversity emergencies.

;

;Speaking at the event, named after former US president John F Kennedy's Moonshot challenge in the 1960s, the prince said “hope does remain” even as the effects of the climate crisis become “too visible to be ignored”. The prince was wearing a blazer by Alexander McQueen which has been part of his wardrobe for 10 years. He previously wore it for the inaugural Earthshot awards in 2021.

;

;“The last year has been one of great change and even greater challenge,” he said. “A year that has left so many feeling defeated, their hope dwindling. However, as we have seen tonight, hope does remain.”

;

;Future generations, said the prince, would “look back on this decade as the point at which we globally took collective action for our planet … The moment we refused to accept the voices of denial and defeatism, and instead became the architects of change towards a healthy and sustainable world.

;

;“We owe it to the generations that will follow us to work together both for their future, and for the future of our planet. It is my belief that we will find the courage to do so. We will find the courage because we will hold on to the most powerful motivators of all – optimism and hope.”

;

;The five winning projects, which each received a £1m prize, were:

;

;;•; GRST's project to build and recycle lithium-ion batteries in a cleaner and more sustainable way.

;

;;•; WildAid Marine programme's initiative to bring together governments, scientists and campaigners to tackle illegal fishing and strengthen ocean conservation.

;

;;•; S4S Technologies' scheme to develop solar-powered dryers and processing equipment to enable small-hold farmers to preserve crops and turn what would have been waste into valuable products.

;

;;•; Boomitra's project with 150,000 farmers in some of the poorest parts of Africa, South America and Asia to reduce emissions and boost profits by incentivising land restoration through a verified carbon credit marketplace.

;

;;•; Accion Andina, a project that unites tens of thousands of people in local and Indigenous communities in the Andes mountain range to protect and restore the native forests and ecosystems.

;

;The winners were selected by the prince and the Earthshot Prize Council, which was chaired by Christiana Figueres, one of the architects of the climate agreement signed in Paris in 2015.

;

;The organisers said all five winners plus 10 other finalists would receive mentorship, resources, and technical support from the Earthshot Prize fellowship, a year-long programme to accelerate the growth of their projects.

;

;Earthshot Prize council member Sir David Attenborough made a video appearance during the ceremony, telling the audience “we can live both well and responsibly on our planet”. He added: “Tonight, we celebrate those who are leading the way to this better future.”
